title: How many trees are left in the world in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: The recent finding by NASA and published in the journal Nature Sustainability, compared satellite data from the mid-1990s to today using high-resolution imagery. Initially, the researchers were unsure what caused the significant uptick in greening around the planet. It was unclear whether a warming planet, increased carbon dioxide (CO2) or a wetter climate could have caused more plants to grow.
17,833,571,005,132. Oops 533,022 just logged and 11,385,473 planted or naturally germinated. So hard to keep track!
